wikipedia_page.main: Charles Wyndham Goodwyn  (11 March 1934 – 10 June 2015) was a British philatelist, and was Keeper of the Royal Philatelic Collection from September 1995 to January 2003. He was an expert in the philately of Hong Kong and China.

response: The last three keepers of the Royal Philatelic Collection have been John Marriott (1969–1995), Charles Wyndham Goodwyn (1995–2002),Biography The National Postal Museum, retrieved 17 August 2007. and Michael Sefi from 1 January 2003 to 2018.

Facing an increasing amount of work and activities, he was the first keeper of the Royal Collection to have a deputy: Charles Wyndham Goodwyn, president of the RPSL since 1991. He helped Marriott mount the collection, prepare exhibitions and write articles that permitted the Royal Philatelic Collection to be self-sufficient. Marriott gave up his function of the keeper to Goodwyn in September 1995.
*Charles Wyndham Goodwyn, British philatelist, Keeper of the Royal Philatelic Collection 1995–2003
**Charles Wyndham Goodwyn, 81, philatelist, Keeper of the Royal Philatelic Collection (1995–2003)
